children.subject: I contacted the instructor of CS184 and Professor Ng confirmed that we don't have an exam during finals week.
So will the time conflict be overridden when we try to enroll in EE16B after CS184?

<md>On Monday, November 8th (when all continuing undergradautes will have had their phase 1), and again on Friday, November 12th (to include new transfers and as a reminder to people who may not have yet responded to the ask earlier that week), I will send email to all students waitlisted for EECS 16B with a link to a google form asking if there is some reason why they think they should be moved into the class that campus systems didn't catch.

I will then move all students into the class who give a reason that makes sense and fits with policy (including conflicts with 184 or other classes that have confirmed no final exam or alternate final exam times; students who were completely remote (i.e., not living in the Bay Area) and dropped 16B when Prof Sahai seemed to indicate students would not be able to take exams remotely, etc.).

Students who can't get on the waitlist can reach out to me separately at that time (ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu) and if they have set aside phase 1 units (ie enrolled and/or waitlisted only enough units that they would have been able to enroll/waitlist had their not been some strange buggy thing going on) and I'll handle those on a case by case basis. </md>
I didn't receive any email today, do I need to reach out to ee-scheduling for this enrollment issue?

I have a record of bccing you (Anon Beaker) the email on November 1st (the subject line was "EECS 16B SP22 Enrollment: Update". I also have a record of poster submitting the form survey. There is nothing else you need to do about this at this time.

I'll send an email to survey respondents whose reasons given don't justify being moved to the front of the line tomorrow afternoon. If you filled out the survey and don't receive an email from sasson@berkeley.edu about this by the end of the day tomorrow (Wednesday Nov 10) then it means your request is still being considered.

As you replied, "I will then move all students into the class who give a reason that makes sense and fits with policy (including conflicts with 184 or other classes that have confirmed no final exam or alternate final exam times; students who were completely remote (i.e., not living in the Bay Area) and dropped 16B when Prof Sahai seemed to indicate students would not be able to take exams remotely, etc.)."

I met both the two reasons, but I received an email saying that I can't be prioritized.

Why? Can I get a chance to get into the class without dropping CS184?

<md>Classes whose lectures are scheduled to conflict will also, if they have regularly scheduled final exams which 16B certainly does and 184 I believe does, have final exams that conflict. Faculty may, but do not have to, provide alternate exam times. You can reach out to the instructors and ask if they will. If you have that confirmed, department staff will likely be able to override the time conflict when asked. You will not be able to just enroll via calcentral. </md>

history.content:
Currently on the waitlist for EE16B, which says it doesn't allow time conflict. BUT... how about if it "conflicting" with an asynchronies CS UD (CS184) scheduled at the same time that DOES allows time conflicts?

Will I be able to sign up for both of them on Cal Central?

I would like to know because-- I want to do it-- but I would have to drop the current CS UD (INFO 159) I'm on the waitlist for in order to try to sign up for the the "16b conflicting" asynchronies class (CS184) with no idea if it'll allow me. Which puts me at risk for going much higher on the waitlist of INFO 159 when I re-sign up, and possibly not getting into neither class 

These are my only 2 options of classes, and I would much rather just sign up for CS184 since it has open spots for me, and I don't want to be taking a gamble on INFO 159 possibly messing up my expected graduation data
history.subject: Time conflicting class with EE16B exception??
